comments.body: Is this actually considered a BSD-family license? Looks kind of different on a skim.

The license text is from Intellectual Property office at the Brookhaven National Laboratory (BNL) and contains licenses of the previous projects we build on.  The 3-clause BSD is sprinkled in the text at

https://github.com/diffpy/pyobjcryst/blob/35ec0dbd47c24ecb43c1fb8b16d256cb3f805ccf/LICENSE.txt#L51-L68
and
https://github.com/diffpy/pyobjcryst/blob/35ec0dbd47c24ecb43c1fb8b16d256cb3f805ccf/LICENSE.txt#L79-L98

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@  home: https://github.com/diffpy/pyobjcryst
  license: BNL
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Python bindings to the ObjCryst++ crystallographic library.'
